title: Definitions
context: [PART IIA.] CHILD ABUSE AND NEGLECT PREVENTION Cross References Safe place for newborns, see chapter 587D. Shaken baby syndrome (prevention), see ยง321-33. [ยง321-36] Definitions. For the purposes of this part: &ldquo;Child screening for early identification and remediation of social and health problems&rdquo; means routine follow up and progress checks for toddlers and preschoolers which include the location and support of isolated parents in need of assistance. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Education for parenthood&rdquo; means programs to educate all levels of youths as to the needs and appropriate expectations for the different levels of infancy and childhood. &ldquo;Home visitor programs&rdquo; mean services utilizing paraprofessionals or community volunteers for supportive intervention services to parents from the prenatal through infancy periods. &ldquo;Infants in need of extra services&rdquo; include infants who are ill or handicapped or the result of a multiple birth. &ldquo;Mutual aid programs&rdquo; mean peer-support groups for target populations. &ldquo;Perinatal bonding&rdquo; means the process of attachment between parents and newborns around the circumstance of birth. &ldquo;Secondary prevention programs&rdquo; mean programs directed at recognizing, assessing, and achieving change in high risk situations so that abuse and neglect do not occur. [L 1984, c 212, pt of ยง2]
